sourceMeaningMnemonic: Under a <radical>canopy</radical>, someone thinking with a <radical>brush</radical> in their <radical>mouth</radical> has a <kanji>sudden</kanji> thought, and uses the brush to write the word "<kanji>China</kanji>". Thus, China was born.
meaningInfo: All of a sudden China existed! Pretty crazy, right?
readingMnemonic: Believe it or not, this <kanji>sudden</kanji> invention of <kanji>China</kanji> happened in <ja><reading>とう</reading>きょう</ja>. Well, it wasn't <ja>とうきょう</ja> yet. And it was a traveling Chinese person who did it. But you know legends, they're just all over the place.
readingInfo: Oh my gosh, can you imagine how mad China will be when you tell them they were invented in <ja>とうきょう</ja>? Maybe you shouldn't tell anyone this story. Just keep it between you and me, kay?
